text: Arleux-en-Gohelle is a commune in the Pas-de-Calais department in northern France. ==Geography== A village located 7 miles (12 km) north-east of Arras at the junction of the N919 and D50 roads. ==History== The commune name first appears in 1119 as Haluth. The village was all but destroyed during World War I. ==Population== ==Sights== * The church of St. Martin, dating from the twentieth century. * The World War I cemetery. ==See also== *Communes of the Pas-de-Calais department ==References== * INSEE commune file ==External links== * Commonwealth War Graves Commission - Arleux-en-Gohelle (Orchard Dump) Category:Communes of Pas-de-Calais
